subject: Re: [junit] Re: ANT Can't find Tools.jar
msgSnippet: Not sure if it is related, but we found that a particular release of 1.5.0 (can t remember which, and don t know if it has been fixed) would override the
messageBody:
Not sure if it is related, but we found that a particular release of 1.5.0 (can't remember which, and don't know if it has been fixed) would override the pointers in the registry, such that even when you call for 1.4.2, it ultimately points to 1.5.0 and goes for that jre.

-------------- Original message --------------
From: "Damian Murphy" <damodai@...>
I think that your problem is that you have installed a JRE on your
machine and this is what is referenced in your windows
registry.(HKEY_CURRENT_USERS->Software->Javasoft->Java Runtime
Environment) this is where the jre1.5.0_06\lib is found.
As you point out tools.jar is not part of this jre.
You can try
option 1)adding the tools.jar file to the jre1.5.0_06\lib folder
option 2)uninstalling the JRE and installing a JDK(JDK has the tool.jar)
option 3) changing the entry in the registry




--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "whitworthjanet" <janet.e.whitworth@...>
wrote:
>
> Thanks for your response. The problem is that it should NOT be
> looking in program files. I have a j2sdk1.4.2_06 directory on my
> root C: drive and that is what I am referencing in my JAVA_HOME. I
> even went to what should be an unnecessart step to add the tools.jar
> for this directory to my CLASSPATH property. I am not using 1.5 yet
> since it has not been approved by the organization that I work for.
>
> Why when I specifically am pointing to this directory on JAVA_HOME
> and the CLASSPATH is it deciding to look in jre1.5.0_06\lib down
> under Program Files. It is obviously totally ignoring these
> properties and going on its own hunting expedition. The question is,
> how can I get it to stop?
>
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Wayne Fay" <waynefay@> wrote:
> >
> > Might be related to the space in "Program Files"? I've seen
> numerous
> > bugs in Java apps due to spaces on Windows.
> >
> > Perhaps reinstall JDK1.5 in a folder with no space?
> >
> > wf
> >
> > On 5/11/06, whitworthjanet <janet.e.whitworth@> wrote:
> > > Sorry for posting this question here, but I am trying to run ant
> at
> > > home so I can get a junit report and I can't get it to run. I am
> > > getting the following message:
> > >
> > > Unable to locate tools.jar. Expected to find it in C:\Program
> > > Files\Java\jre1.5.0_06\lib\tools.jar
> > >
> > > I have JDK1.4 installed on my c: drive. I have JAVA_HOME
> pointing to
> > > it and I tried putting the tools.jar on my classpath environment
> > > variable. I don't know why it is looking down in C:\Program
> Files\Java
> > > or if it just went searching on its own why it didn't pick up
> either
> > > the 1.4 or 1.5 JDK directories that are in that directory.
> > >
> > > Has anyone had a problem with this or have any ideas what I
> should try
> > > next? I already checked the bug reports on the Apache web site
> and
> > > couldn't anything like this.
>
